rules.ruleString: Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {PGC5001, PGC5101, VCG5011}
Must be enrolled in course version {3454, 3460, 3462, 3465, 3467, 3468, 3470, P4001, P6002}

description: This unit examines aspects of clinical laboratory data, monitoring patient signs and symptoms and issues in therapeutics. Areas covered include pharmacokinetics, clinical pharmacy, cardiology and topics in general medicine.  The focus of these topics is patient care in both hospital and community settings. Students must be practicing pharmacists in positions with patient contact. To undertake this unit students are required to contribute their own cases.
faculty: Faculty of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences
